questions.question: Why do we need a separate formula for the derivative in discrete space?
options: It is because we can't get arbitrarily close since we are stuck with integer values.
The derivative in discrete space does not represent the rate of change anymore
They are two completely different concepts

questions.question: What does correlation have to do with calculating derivatives?
options: You can use it to calculate the derivative of an 2D matrix by correlating with a specific kernel, convolution also has this property
You can use it to calculate the derivative of an 2D matrix by correlating with a specific kernel, convolution also does not have this property

questions.question: What is the border patrol technique called that reflects the values of the pixels along the border?
What is an image synthesis system?
options: Systems that generate new or augment existing images, starting from a specific set of data.

Systems that analyze images to such a level that a predefinied set of meaningful structures can be isolated (located) in the image (the system understands the image; e.g., detecting metallic particles on a conveyor belt carrying food);
Systems that process incoming sensor data with the objective to generate images that are suited for human interpretation.

questions.question: Why do we need to sample images?
options: In real life images are continuous signals, we can't work with those on a computer so we need to extract discrete datapoints.
In real life images are discrete signals, we can't work with those on a computer so we need to extract discrete datapoints.
In real life images are continuous signals, we can't work with those on a computer so we need to extract continuous datapoints.

questions.question: What is spatial resolution?
options: The spatial resolution of an image, an image sensor (camera) or an image actuator (screen) indicates the size of the smallest feature that can be recognized in the image.
The spatial resolution of an image, indicates the number of pixels per unit area.
The spatial resolution of an image is the amount of pixels it contains

questions.question: Which term is not associated with resampling?
What is interpolation used for?
options: To create logical value between to datapoints.
To change the value of two datapoints

questions.question: What is the difference between sampling and quantization?
options: Sampling is discretization of the domain, quantization is discretization of the values themselves.
Quantization is discretization of the domain, sampling is discretization of the values themselves.

questions.question: Which intensity transformation makes an image strictly brighter
options: This cannot be achieved through an intensity transformation.
